popt4jlib

Class FunctionEvaluationTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.FunctionEvaluationTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, TaskObject

    public class FunctionEvaluationTask
extends java.lang.Object
implements TaskObject
    auxiliary class used when the user requests function evaluations to be executed in separate threads in a thread-pool for a limited time so as to avoid "locking-up" the minimization process by function evaluations that take too long to complete (such evaluations are "lost" by the minimization process even if they eventually complete). For more details, see the LimitedTimeTaskExecutor class in the parallel package, and the LimitedTimeEvalFunction class in this package. The class and its methods are of course thread-safe (as long as the underlying function object that implements the FunctionIntf interface to be evaluated also happens to be thread-safe).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2015

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public java.io.Serializable run()
        the main method calls the f.eval(arg, params) method of the arument f passed in the constructor argument, with argument the arg passed in and the parameters params all passed in the constructor. After the function f is evaluated the method setObjValue(val) with value the result of the evaluation is executed, so that it may be gotten from subsequent call to getObjValue(). Also, afterwards, isDone() returns true.
        Specified by:
        run in interface TaskObject
        Returns:
        this
